reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike was a friendly receptionist/waiter who attended all our needs kindly.
reviews.title: A countryside break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is good, portions are countryside big eater sizes.
reviews.title: Lovely Little Hotel

reviews.text: Most customers would have been older than us but in fairness we didn´t feel out of place either.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has a nice athmosphere, its very quiet and peacefull.
reviews.title: idyllic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also most of staff multitask so you wont find a receptionist at all times, the bell is on the right handside of the counter behind a lamp, relevant information if you don´t want to wait 20 minutes for checkout.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing and peaceful trip

reviews.text: We came in with our 5 kids for tea one evening . Most hotels would be happy to see a big family group arriving but there ewas barely a hello . I felt uncomfortable . Typical Irish place that hates kids . One of my kids had an accident when we are there, he fell into the stream outside the front door . The owners/manager knew what had happened , they never asked was he ok . I completely accept that its my responsibility to look after my own kids but a simple acknowledgement of the wet clothes and cut on his forehead would not have hurt . Or maybe there was some "liability" issues . Food was awful , the oil in the deep fat fryer was stale and needed changing weeks before . I won't be going back as it was also very expensive . The staff seemed miserable too.
reviews.title: couldn't recommend
Reservation not honoured.
reviews.text: Donegal seemed like the perfect spot to spend the long weekend. So two months ago we booked the Lake House and a couple of rounds of golf at the beautiful Nairn and Portnoo links.We arrived at the Lake House at 4p.m. on Saturday 4th August to be greeted with the news that the hotel was "overbooked" and that there was no room available. The receptionist readily acknowledged that we had a confirmed reservation and even showed us our name in the reservation book for the correct date.No effort had been made to find alternative accommodation or indeed offer any form of compensation. As we did not have the opportunity to avail of the hospitality of the Lake House we unfortunetly cannot rate the hotel but we would strongly advise any potential guest to think very carefully before making a reservation in this hotel which treats customers with complete disdain and fails abysmally in that most crucial of all functions i.e. honouring a commitment made.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for two nlghts had one evening meal very dissapointed with service in resturant. breakfast was very poor continental consists of ceral no fruit.after a day trip walking no hot water for shower wait 30 min.hotel very basic breakfast not included in price.very dear for just a standard room.
reviews.title: dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just had a couple of days away in this lovely hotel in Donegal, unfortunately the weather was not good to us, but that was not the hotels fault.
reviews.title: small but beautiful.

reviews.text: on arrival i realised i had forgotten my much needed Insulin, Mary the manager could not have been more helpful, first ringing people she knew who were diabetic, none of those people were able to help out their medication different to mine, with it being Sunday evening no Chemists available. she then rang a lady who is a nurse and between her and Mary's son John they got me the insulin I needed, John drove over an hour each way to get it, how is that for service?
reviews.title: A welcome retreat after a long journey

reviews.text: Only stayed one night with my mum, our room was spaceous and nicely decorated, liked the seated area upstairs where you could chill out . Was very pleased with the hotel, the evening meal and the staff.
reviews.title: And the ocean is just over the hill....

reviews.text: Only one thing my mum thought could be improved, curtains were made from a light fabric and let in too much light in the early morning.
reviews.title: FAMILY GET TOGETHER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful part of Donegal and the beach is just over the hill, its lovely and clean with hardly anyone on it, just fantastic.
reviews.title: The Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the way home we stopped in Ardara and found a lovely coffee shop (centre of town on the left) with delicious home made food.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.text: The hotel is tucked away in a beautiful setting. We recently stayed with our family as a large group for a 50th anniversary and the staff were excellent. Any queries were dealt with efficiently and staff dealt with all requests as though they were looking after one of their own family.
reviews.title: Excellent short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only booked into Lake House Hotel for one night, and so our review is based on that short stay. Food excellent, staff friendly, tour advice brilliant. We will certainly be back.
reviews.title: AN EXCELLENT SHORT BREAK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a very warm handshake on arrival from Frank, the proprietor, which made us feel very welcome. Our accommodation was spotlessly clean, and most comfortable with an enchanting view of the lake. Although the hotel was busy there was a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. We breakfasted and dined in and found the food to be most satisfying. After dinner we adjourned to the bar where conversation flowed freely between guests and visiting locals. Michael, who tends the bar is a living encyclopaedia of local information. If you visit, take his advice and you won't be disappointed. Scenery and sunsets are amazing. We will visit the Lake House Hotel again.
reviews.title: A. and M. C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel set in beautiful surroundings - great good value for money food and staff excellent. We stayed in the garden room which is great and so private. Would have no hestitation inrecommending this hotel to anyone and its great location is so handy for the beautiful Nairn beach and Sandfield pitch and putt
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at this charming hotel beautifully situated overlooking Clooney lake and Port Noo golf course. The hotel is perfect for walkers, cyclists, golfers and of course motorists wishing to explore the coast and countryside in the Donegal area. The hospitality shown by all staff was second to none, led by Frank the owner/manager. We ate both nights in the hotel, and the food and wine were excellent, as was the service. Our room was large, clean and comfortable, (perhaps a little old fashioned) with good views of the beautiful scenery.........Highly recommended......We'll be back.....
reviews.title: John and Connie, Lisburn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We, and our dogs, stayed 5 nights at this wondeful hotel, tucked into a gorgeous part of Donegal. We stayed in the 'garden room' which was excellent for our needs, having the dogs there too. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and Frank, the manager, is a great character with a marvellous knowledge of the local interests to see and do. The weather deteriorated towards the end of our stay but we were having such a lovely time we stayed on an extra night instead of going home. A true home from home. Would definitely recommend this hotel and we and bow-wows will be back again.
reviews.title: A True Gem
